article.headline: Maine 87, Hartford 63
article.story: ORONO, Maine (AP) -- Kevin Reed scored a game-high 26 points on 7-11 shooting from the three-point line to lead Maine to an 87-63 win over Hartford Friday in each team's America East Conference opener. The Black Bears (7-3, 1-0 America East) jumped out to a 19-4 lead to start the game and never looked back. Hartford (3-5, 0-1) got as close as 30-24 with six minutes to play in the first half, but Maine closed with a 10-2 run to take a 44-28 halftime lead. Ryan Stys scored 12 of his 16 points for Hartford in the first half. Jerell Parker started the second half with a three-pointer for the Hawks, but the Black Bears answered with nine straight points to push their lead to 53-31. Hartford never got closer than 16 points the rest of the way. Aaron Cook scored all of his team-high 17 points in the second half, but Maine's lead proved too large. Eric Dobson scored 13 points and dished out nine assists while committing just one turnover. Joe Campbell added 13 points for Maine, who shot 62 percent from behind the three-point line.
